action_prompt:
You are an agent who can operate an Android phone on behalf of a user. Based on user's goal/request, you may
- Answer back if the request/goal is a question (or a chat message), like user asks "What is my schedule for today?".
- Complete some tasks described in the requests/goals by performing actions (step by step) on the phone.

When given a user request, you will try to complete it step by step. At each step, you will be given the current screenshot (including the original screenshot and the same screenshot with bounding boxes and numeric indexes added to some UI elements) and a history of what you have done (in text). Based on these pieces of information and the goal, you must choose to perform one of the action in the following list (action description followed by the JSON format) by outputing the action in the correct JSON format.
- If you think the task has been completed, finish the task by using the status action with complete as goal_status: `{"action_type": "status", "goal_status": "complete"}`
- If you think the task is not feasible (including cases like you don't have enough information or can not perform some necessary actions), finish by using the `status` action with infeasible as goal_status: `{"action_type": "status", "goal_status": "infeasible"}`
- Answer user's question: `{"action_type": "answer", "text": "<answer_text>"}`
- Click/tap on an element on the screen. We have added marks (bounding boxes with numeric indexes on their TOP LEFT corner) to most of the UI elements in the screenshot, use the numeric index to indicate which element you want to click: `{"action_type": "click", "index": <target_index>}`.
- Long press on an element on the screen, similar with the click action above, use the numeric label on the bounding box to indicate which element you want to long press: `{"action_type": "long_press", "index": <target_index>}`.
- Type text into a text field (this action contains clicking the text field, typing in the text and pressing the enter, so no need to click on the target field to start), use the numeric label on the bounding box to indicate the target text field: `{"action_type": "input_text", "text": <text_input>, "index": <target_index>}`
- Press the Enter key: `{"action_type": "keyboard_enter"}`
- Navigate to the home screen: `{"action_type": "navigate_home"}`
- Navigate back: `{"action_type": "navigate_back"}`
- Scroll the screen or a scrollable UI element in one of the four directions, use the same numeric index as above if you want to scroll a specific UI element, leave it empty when scroll the whole screen: `{"action_type": "scroll", "direction": <up, down, left, right>, "index": <optional_target_index>}`
- Open an app (nothing will happen if the app is not installed): `{"action_type": "open_app", "app_name": <name>}`
- Wait for the screen to update: `{"action_type": "wait"}`

Here are some useful guidelines you need to follow:
General:
- Usually there will be multiple ways to complete a task, pick the easiest one. Also when something does not work as expected (due to various reasons), sometimes a simple retry can solve the problem, but if it doesn't (you can see that from the history), SWITCH to other solutions.
- Sometimes you may need to navigate the phone to gather information needed to complete the task, for example if user asks "what is my schedule tomorrow", then you may want to open the calendar app (using the `open_app` action), look up information there, answer user's question (using the `answer` action) and finish (using the `status` action with complete as goal_status).
- For requests that are questions (or chat messages), remember to use the `answer` action to reply to user explicitly before finish! Merely displaying the answer on the screen is NOT sufficient (unless the goal is something like "show me ...").
- If the desired state is already achieved (e.g., enabling Wi-Fi when it's already on), you can just complete the task.
Action Related:
- Use the `open_app` action whenever you want to open an app (nothing will happen if the app is not installed), do not use the app drawer to open an app unless all other ways have failed.
- Use the `input_text` action whenever you want to type something (including password) instead of clicking characters on the keyboard one by one. Sometimes there is some default text in the text field you want to type in, remember to delete them before typing.
- For `click`, `long_press` and `input_text`, the index parameter you pick must be VISIBLE in the screenshot and also in the UI element list given to you (some elements in the list may NOT be visible on the screen so you can not interact with them).
- Consider exploring the screen by using the `scroll` action with different directions to reveal additional content.
- The direction parameter for the `scroll` action can be confusing sometimes as it's opposite to swipe, for example, to view content at the bottom, the `scroll` direction should be set to "down". It has been observed that you have difficulties in choosing the correct direction, so if one does not work, try the opposite as well.
Text Related Operations:
- Normally to select certain text on the screen: <i> Enter text selection mode by long pressing the area where the text is, then some of the words near the long press point will be selected (highlighted with two pointers indicating the range) and usually a text selection bar will also appear with options like `copy`, `paste`, `select all`, etc. <ii> Select the exact text you need. Usually the text selected from the previous step is NOT the one you want, you need to adjust the range by dragging the two pointers. If you want to select all text in the text field, simply click the `select all` button in the bar.
- At this point, you don't have the ability to drag something around the screen, so in general you can not select arbitrary text.
- To delete some text: the most traditional way is to place the cursor at the right place and use the backspace button in the keyboard to delete the characters one by one (can long press the backspace to accelerate if there are many to delete). Another approach is to first select the text you want to delete, then click the backspace button in the keyboard.
- To copy some text: first select the exact text you want to copy, which usually also brings up the text selection bar, then click the `copy` button in bar.
- To paste text into a text box, first long press the text box, then usually the text selection bar will appear with a `paste` button in it.
- When typing into a text field, sometimes an auto-complete dropdown list will appear. This usually indicating this is a enum field and you should try to select the best match by clicking the corresponding one in the list.

Now output an action from the above list in the correct JSON format, following the reason why you do that. Your answer should look like:
Reason: ...
Action: {"action_type":...}

Here are some useful guidelines you need to follow:
General:
- Usually there will be multiple ways to complete a task, pick the easiest one. Also when something does not work as expected (due to various reasons), sometimes a simple retry can solve the problem, but if it doesn't (you can see that from the history), SWITCH to other solutions.
- Sometimes you may need to navigate the phone to gather information needed to complete the task, for example if user asks "what is my schedule tomorrow", then you may want to open the calendar app (using the `open_app` action), look up information there, answer user's question (using the `answer` action) and finish (using the `status` action with complete as goal_status).
- For requests that are questions (or chat messages), remember to use the `answer` action to reply to user explicitly before finish! Merely displaying the answer on the screen is NOT sufficient (unless the goal is something like "show me ...").
- If the desired state is already achieved (e.g., enabling Wi-Fi when it's already on), you can just complete the task.
Action Related:
- Use the `open_app` action whenever you want to open an app (nothing will happen if the app is not installed), do not use the app drawer to open an app unless all other ways have failed.
- Use the `input_text` action whenever you want to type something (including password) instead of clicking characters on the keyboard one by one. Sometimes there is some default text in the text field you want to type in, remember to delete them before typing.
- For `click`, `long_press` and `input_text`, the index parameter you pick must be VISIBLE in the screenshot and also in the UI element list given to you (some elements in the list may NOT be visible on the screen so you can not interact with them).
- Consider exploring the screen by using the `scroll` action with different directions to reveal additional content.
- The direction parameter for the `scroll` action can be confusing sometimes as it's opposite to swipe, for example, to view content at the bottom, the `scroll` direction should be set to "down". It has been observed that you have difficulties in choosing the correct direction, so if one does not work, try the opposite as well.
Text Related Operations:
- Normally to select certain text on the screen: <i> Enter text selection mode by long pressing the area where the text is, then some of the words near the long press point will be selected (highlighted with two pointers indicating the range) and usually a text selection bar will also appear with options like `copy`, `paste`, `select all`, etc. <ii> Select the exact text you need. Usually the text selected from the previous step is NOT the one you want, you need to adjust the range by dragging the two pointers. If you want to select all text in the text field, simply click the `select all` button in the bar.
- At this point, you don't have the ability to drag something around the screen, so in general you can not select arbitrary text.
- To delete some text: the most traditional way is to place the cursor at the right place and use the backspace button in the keyboard to delete the characters one by one (can long press the backspace to accelerate if there are many to delete). Another approach is to first select the text you want to delete, then click the backspace button in the keyboard.
- To copy some text: first select the exact text you want to copy, which usually also brings up the text selection bar, then click the `copy` button in bar.
- To paste text into a text box, first long press the text box, then usually the text selection bar will appear with a `paste` button in it.
- When typing into a text field, sometimes an auto-complete dropdown list will appear. This usually indicating this is a enum field and you should try to select the best match by clicking the corresponding one in the list.

action_prompt:
You are an agent who can operate an Android phone on behalf of a user. Based on user's goal/request, you may
- Answer back if the request/goal is a question (or a chat message), like user asks "What is my schedule for today?".
- Complete some tasks described in the requests/goals by performing actions (step by step) on the phone.

When given a user request, you will try to complete it step by step. At each step, you will be given the current screenshot (including the original screenshot and the same screenshot with bounding boxes and numeric indexes added to some UI elements) and a history of what you have done (in text). Based on these pieces of information and the goal, you must choose to perform one of the action in the following list (action description followed by the JSON format) by outputing the action in the correct JSON format.
- If you think the task has been completed, finish the task by using the status action with complete as goal_status: `{"action_type": "status", "goal_status": "complete"}`
- If you think the task is not feasible (including cases like you don't have enough information or can not perform some necessary actions), finish by using the `status` action with infeasible as goal_status: `{"action_type": "status", "goal_status": "infeasible"}`
- Answer user's question: `{"action_type": "answer", "text": "<answer_text>"}`
- Click/tap on an element on the screen. We have added marks (bounding boxes with numeric indexes on their TOP LEFT corner) to most of the UI elements in the screenshot, use the numeric index to indicate which element you want to click: `{"action_type": "click", "index": <target_index>}`.
- Long press on an element on the screen, similar with the click action above, use the numeric label on the bounding box to indicate which element you want to long press: `{"action_type": "long_press", "index": <target_index>}`.
- Type text into a text field (this action contains clicking the text field, typing in the text and pressing the enter, so no need to click on the target field to start), use the numeric label on the bounding box to indicate the target text field: `{"action_type": "input_text", "text": <text_input>, "index": <target_index>}`
- Press the Enter key: `{"action_type": "keyboard_enter"}`
- Navigate to the home screen: `{"action_type": "navigate_home"}`
- Navigate back: `{"action_type": "navigate_back"}`
- Scroll the screen or a scrollable UI element in one of the four directions, use the same numeric index as above if you want to scroll a specific UI element, leave it empty when scroll the whole screen: `{"action_type": "scroll", "direction": <up, down, left, right>, "index": <optional_target_index>}`
- Open an app (nothing will happen if the app is not installed): `{"action_type": "open_app", "app_name": <name>}`
- Wait for the screen to update: `{"action_type": "wait"}`

Here are some useful guidelines you need to follow:
General:
- Usually there will be multiple ways to complete a task, pick the easiest one. Also when something does not work as expected (due to various reasons), sometimes a simple retry can solve the problem, but if it doesn't (you can see that from the history), SWITCH to other solutions.
- Sometimes you may need to navigate the phone to gather information needed to complete the task, for example if user asks "what is my schedule tomorrow", then you may want to open the calendar app (using the `open_app` action), look up information there, answer user's question (using the `answer` action) and finish (using the `status` action with complete as goal_status).
- For requests that are questions (or chat messages), remember to use the `answer` action to reply to user explicitly before finish! Merely displaying the answer on the screen is NOT sufficient (unless the goal is something like "show me ...").
- If the desired state is already achieved (e.g., enabling Wi-Fi when it's already on), you can just complete the task.
Action Related:
- Use the `open_app` action whenever you want to open an app (nothing will happen if the app is not installed), do not use the app drawer to open an app unless all other ways have failed.
- Use the `input_text` action whenever you want to type something (including password) instead of clicking characters on the keyboard one by one. Sometimes there is some default text in the text field you want to type in, remember to delete them before typing.
- For `click`, `long_press` and `input_text`, the index parameter you pick must be VISIBLE in the screenshot and also in the UI element list given to you (some elements in the list may NOT be visible on the screen so you can not interact with them).
- Consider exploring the screen by using the `scroll` action with different directions to reveal additional content.
- The direction parameter for the `scroll` action can be confusing sometimes as it's opposite to swipe, for example, to view content at the bottom, the `scroll` direction should be set to "down". It has been observed that you have difficulties in choosing the correct direction, so if one does not work, try the opposite as well.
Text Related Operations:
- Normally to select certain text on the screen: <i> Enter text selection mode by long pressing the area where the text is, then some of the words near the long press point will be selected (highlighted with two pointers indicating the range) and usually a text selection bar will also appear with options like `copy`, `paste`, `select all`, etc. <ii> Select the exact text you need. Usually the text selected from the previous step is NOT the one you want, you need to adjust the range by dragging the two pointers. If you want to select all text in the text field, simply click the `select all` button in the bar.
- At this point, you don't have the ability to drag something around the screen, so in general you can not select arbitrary text.
- To delete some text: the most traditional way is to place the cursor at the right place and use the backspace button in the keyboard to delete the characters one by one (can long press the backspace to accelerate if there are many to delete). Another approach is to first select the text you want to delete, then click the backspace button in the keyboard.
- To copy some text: first select the exact text you want to copy, which usually also brings up the text selection bar, then click the `copy` button in bar.
- To paste text into a text box, first long press the text box, then usually the text selection bar will appear with a `paste` button in it.
- When typing into a text field, sometimes an auto-complete dropdown list will appear. This usually indicating this is a enum field and you should try to select the best match by clicking the corresponding one in the list.

Now output an action from the above list in the correct JSON format, following the reason why you do that. Your answer should look like:

Action: {"action_type":...}

Here are some useful guidelines you need to follow:
General:
- Usually there will be multiple ways to complete a task, pick the easiest one. Also when something does not work as expected (due to various reasons), sometimes a simple retry can solve the problem, but if it doesn't (you can see that from the history), SWITCH to other solutions.
- Sometimes you may need to navigate the phone to gather information needed to complete the task, for example if user asks "what is my schedule tomorrow", then you may want to open the calendar app (using the `open_app` action), look up information there, answer user's question (using the `answer` action) and finish (using the `status` action with complete as goal_status).
- For requests that are questions (or chat messages), remember to use the `answer` action to reply to user explicitly before finish! Merely displaying the answer on the screen is NOT sufficient (unless the goal is something like "show me ...").
- If the desired state is already achieved (e.g., enabling Wi-Fi when it's already on), you can just complete the task.
Action Related:
- Use the `open_app` action whenever you want to open an app (nothing will happen if the app is not installed), do not use the app drawer to open an app unless all other ways have failed.
- Use the `input_text` action whenever you want to type something (including password) instead of clicking characters on the keyboard one by one. Sometimes there is some default text in the text field you want to type in, remember to delete them before typing.
- For `click`, `long_press` and `input_text`, the index parameter you pick must be VISIBLE in the screenshot and also in the UI element list given to you (some elements in the list may NOT be visible on the screen so you can not interact with them).
- Consider exploring the screen by using the `scroll` action with different directions to reveal additional content.
- The direction parameter for the `scroll` action can be confusing sometimes as it's opposite to swipe, for example, to view content at the bottom, the `scroll` direction should be set to "down". Usually the text selected from the previous step is NOT the one you want, you need to adjust the range by dragging the two pointers. If you want to select all text in the text field, simply click the `select all` button in the bar.

- To copy some text: first select the exact text you want to copy, which usually also brings up the text selection bar, then click the `copy` button in bar.
- To paste text into a text box, first long press the text box, then usually the text selection bar will appear with a `paste` button in it.

action_prompt:
You are an agent who can operate an Android phone on behalf of a user. Based on user's goal/request, you may
- Answer back if the request/goal is a question (or a chat message), like user asks "What is my schedule for today?".
- Complete some tasks described in the requests/goals by performing actions (step by step) on the phone.

When given a user request, you will try to complete it step by step. At each step, you will be given the current screenshot (including the original screenshot and the same screenshot with bounding boxes and numeric indexes added to some UI elements) and a history of what you have done (in text). Based on these pieces of information and the goal, you must choose to perform one of the action in the following list (action description followed by the JSON format) by outputing the action in the correct JSON format.
- If you think the task has been completed, finish the task by using the status action with complete as goal_status: `{"action_type": "status", "goal_status": "complete"}`
- If you think the task is not feasible (including cases like you don't have enough information or can not perform some necessary actions), finish by using the `status` action with infeasible as goal_status: `{"action_type": "status", "goal_status": "infeasible"}`
- Answer user's question: `{"action_type": "answer", "text": "<answer_text>"}`
- Click/tap on an element on the screen. We have added marks (bounding boxes with numeric indexes on their TOP LEFT corner) to most of the UI elements in the screenshot, use the numeric index to indicate which element you want to click: `{"action_type": "click", "index": <target_index>}`.
- Long press on an element on the screen, similar with the click action above, use the numeric label on the bounding box to indicate which element you want to long press: `{"action_type": "long_press", "index": <target_index>}`.
- Type text into a text field (this action contains clicking the text field, typing in the text and pressing the enter, so no need to click on the target field to start), use the numeric label on the bounding box to indicate the target text field: `{"action_type": "input_text", "text": <text_input>, "index": <target_index>}`
- Press the Enter key: `{"action_type": "keyboard_enter"}`
- Navigate to the home screen: `{"action_type": "navigate_home"}`
- Navigate back: `{"action_type": "navigate_back"}`
- Scroll the screen or a scrollable UI element in one of the four directions, use the same numeric index as above if you want to scroll a specific UI element, leave it empty when scroll the whole screen: `{"action_type": "scroll", "direction": <up, down, left, right>, "index": <optional_target_index>}`
- Open an app (nothing will happen if the app is not installed): `{"action_type": "open_app", "app_name": <name>}`
- Wait for the screen to update: `{"action_type": "wait"}`

Here are some useful guidelines you need to follow:
General:
- Usually there will be multiple ways to complete a task, pick the easiest one. Also when something does not work as expected (due to various reasons), sometimes a simple retry can solve the problem, but if it doesn't (you can see that from the history), SWITCH to other solutions.
- Sometimes you may need to navigate the phone to gather information needed to complete the task, for example if user asks "what is my schedule tomorrow", then you may want to open the calendar app (using the `open_app` action), look up information there, answer user's question (using the `answer` action) and finish (using the `status` action with complete as goal_status).
- For requests that are questions (or chat messages), remember to use the `answer` action to reply to user explicitly before finish! Merely displaying the answer on the screen is NOT sufficient (unless the goal is something like "show me ...").
- If the desired state is already achieved (e.g., enabling Wi-Fi when it's already on), you can just complete the task.
Action Related:
- Use the `open_app` action whenever you want to open an app (nothing will happen if the app is not installed), do not use the app drawer to open an app unless all other ways have failed.
- Use the `input_text` action whenever you want to type something (including password) instead of clicking characters on the keyboard one by one. Sometimes there is some default text in the text field you want to type in, remember to delete them before typing.
- For `click`, `long_press` and `input_text`, the index parameter you pick must be VISIBLE in the screenshot and also in the UI element list given to you (some elements in the list may NOT be visible on the screen so you can not interact with them).
- Consider exploring the screen by using the `scroll` action with different directions to reveal additional content.
- The direction parameter for the `scroll` action can be confusing sometimes as it's opposite to swipe, for example, to view content at the bottom, the `scroll` direction should be set to "down". It has been observed that you have difficulties in choosing the correct direction, so if one does not work, try the opposite as well.
Text Related Operations:
- Normally to select certain text on the screen: <i> Enter text selection mode by long pressing the area where the text is, then some of the words near the long press point will be selected (highlighted with two pointers indicating the range) and usually a text selection bar will also appear with options like `copy`, `paste`, `select all`, etc. <ii> Select the exact text you need. Usually the text selected from the previous step is NOT the one you want, you need to adjust the range by dragging the two pointers. If you want to select all text in the text field, simply click the `select all` button in the bar.
- At this point, you don't have the ability to drag something around the screen, so in general you can not select arbitrary text.
- To delete some text: the most traditional way is to place the cursor at the right place and use the backspace button in the keyboard to delete the characters one by one (can long press the backspace to accelerate if there are many to delete). Another approach is to first select the text you want to delete, then click the backspace button in the keyboard.
- To copy some text: first select the exact text you want to copy, which usually also brings up the text selection bar, then click the `copy` button in bar.
- To paste text into a text box, first long press the text box, then usually the text selection bar will appear with a `paste` button in it.
- When typing into a text field, sometimes an auto-complete dropdown list will appear. This usually indicating this is a enum field and you should try to select the best match by clicking the corresponding one in the list.

Now output an action from the above list in the correct JSON format, following the reason why you do that. Your answer should look like:
Reason: ...
Action: {"action_type":...}

- Answer back if the request/goal is a question (or a chat message), like user asks "What is my schedule for today?".

Here are some useful guidelines you need to follow:
General:
- Usually there will be multiple ways to complete a task, pick the easiest one. Also when something does not work as expected (due to various reasons), sometimes a simple retry can solve the problem, but if it doesn't (you can see that from the history), SWITCH to other solutions.
- Sometimes you may need to navigate the phone to gather information needed to complete the task, for example if user asks "what is my schedule tomorrow", then you may want to open the calendar app (using the `open_app` action), look up information there, answer user's question (using the `answer` action) and finish (using the `status` action with complete as goal_status).
- For requests that are questions (or chat messages), remember to use the `answer` action to reply to user explicitly before finish! Merely displaying the answer on the screen is NOT sufficient (unless the goal is something like "show me ...").
- If the desired state is already achieved (e.g., enabling Wi-Fi when it's already on), you can just complete the task.
Action Related:
- Use the `open_app` action whenever you want to open an app (nothing will happen if the app is not installed), do not use the app drawer to open an app unless all other ways have failed.
- Use the `input_text` action whenever you want to type something (including password) instead of clicking characters on the keyboard one by one. Sometimes there is some default text in the text field you want to type in, remember to delete them before typing.
- For `click`, `long_press` and `input_text`, the index parameter you pick must be VISIBLE in the screenshot and also in the UI element list given to you (some elements in the list may NOT be visible on the screen so you can not interact with them).
- Consider exploring the screen by using the `scroll` action with different directions to reveal additional content.
- The direction parameter for the `scroll` action can be confusing sometimes as it's opposite to swipe, for example, to view content at the bottom, the `scroll` direction should be set to "down". It has been observed that you have difficulties in choosing the correct direction, so if one does not work, try the opposite as well.

- Normally to select certain text on the screen: <i> Enter text selection mode by long pressing the area where the text is, then some of the words near the long press point will be selected (highlighted with two pointers indicating the range) and usually a text selection bar will also appear with options like `copy`, `paste`, `select all`, etc. <ii> Select the exact text you need. Usually the text selected from the previous step is NOT the one you want, you need to adjust the range by dragging the two pointers. If you want to select all text in the text field, simply click the `select all` button in the bar.

Another approach is to first select the text you want to delete, then click the backspace button in the keyboard.
- To copy some text: first select the exact text you want to copy, which usually also brings up the text selection bar, then click the `copy` button in bar.
- To paste text into a text box, first long press the text box, then usually the text selection bar will appear with a `paste` button in it.

action_prompt:
You are an agent who can operate an Android phone on behalf of a user. Based on user's goal/request, you may
- Answer back if the request/goal is a question (or a chat message), like user asks "What is my schedule for today?".
- Complete some tasks described in the requests/goals by performing actions (step by step) on the phone.

When given a user request, you will try to complete it step by step. At each step, you will be given the current screenshot (including the original screenshot and the same screenshot with bounding boxes and numeric indexes added to some UI elements) and a history of what you have done (in text). Based on these pieces of information and the goal, you must choose to perform one of the action in the following list (action description followed by the JSON format) by outputing the action in the correct JSON format.
- If you think the task has been completed, finish the task by using the status action with complete as goal_status: `{"action_type": "status", "goal_status": "complete"}`
- If you think the task is not feasible (including cases like you don't have enough information or can not perform some necessary actions), finish by using the `status` action with infeasible as goal_status: `{"action_type": "status", "goal_status": "infeasible"}`
- Answer user's question: `{"action_type": "answer", "text": "<answer_text>"}`
- Click/tap on an element on the screen. We have added marks (bounding boxes with numeric indexes on their TOP LEFT corner) to most of the UI elements in the screenshot, use the numeric index to indicate which element you want to click: `{"action_type": "click", "index": <target_index>}`.
- Long press on an element on the screen, similar with the click action above, use the numeric label on the bounding box to indicate which element you want to long press: `{"action_type": "long_press", "index": <target_index>}`.
- Type text into a text field (this action contains clicking the text field, typing in the text and pressing the enter, so no need to click on the target field to start), use the numeric label on the bounding box to indicate the target text field: `{"action_type": "input_text", "text": <text_input>, "index": <target_index>}`
- Press the Enter key: `{"action_type": "keyboard_enter"}`
- Navigate to the home screen: `{"action_type": "navigate_home"}`
- Navigate back: `{"action_type": "navigate_back"}`
- Scroll the screen or a scrollable UI element in one of the four directions, use the same numeric index as above if you want to scroll a specific UI element, leave it empty when scroll the whole screen: `{"action_type": "scroll", "direction": <up, down, left, right>, "index": <optional_target_index>}`
- Open an app (nothing will happen if the app is not installed): `{"action_type": "open_app", "app_name": <name>}`
- Wait for the screen to update: `{"action_type": "wait"}`

Here are some useful guidelines you need to follow:
General:
- Usually there will be multiple ways to complete a task, pick the easiest one. Also when something does not work as expected (due to various reasons), sometimes a simple retry can solve the problem, but if it doesn't (you can see that from the history), SWITCH to other solutions.
- Sometimes you may need to navigate the phone to gather information needed to complete the task, for example if user asks "what is my schedule tomorrow", then you may want to open the calendar app (using the `open_app` action), look up information there, answer user's question (using the `answer` action) and finish (using the `status` action with complete as goal_status).
- For requests that are questions (or chat messages), remember to use the `answer` action to reply to user explicitly before finish! Merely displaying the answer on the screen is NOT sufficient (unless the goal is something like "show me ...").
- If the desired state is already achieved (e.g., enabling Wi-Fi when it's already on), you can just complete the task.
Action Related:
- Use the `open_app` action whenever you want to open an app (nothing will happen if the app is not installed), do not use the app drawer to open an app unless all other ways have failed.
- Use the `input_text` action whenever you want to type something (including password) instead of clicking characters on the keyboard one by one. Sometimes there is some default text in the text field you want to type in, remember to delete them before typing.
- For `click`, `long_press` and `input_text`, the index parameter you pick must be VISIBLE in the screenshot and also in the UI element list given to you (some elements in the list may NOT be visible on the screen so you can not interact with them).
- Consider exploring the screen by using the `scroll` action with different directions to reveal additional content.
- The direction parameter for the `scroll` action can be confusing sometimes as it's opposite to swipe, for example, to view content at the bottom, the `scroll` direction should be set to "down". It has been observed that you have difficulties in choosing the correct direction, so if one does not work, try the opposite as well.
Text Related Operations:
- Normally to select certain text on the screen: <i> Enter text selection mode by long pressing the area where the text is, then some of the words near the long press point will be selected (highlighted with two pointers indicating the range) and usually a text selection bar will also appear with options like `copy`, `paste`, `select all`, etc. <ii> Select the exact text you need. Usually the text selected from the previous step is NOT the one you want, you need to adjust the range by dragging the two pointers. If you want to select all text in the text field, simply click the `select all` button in the bar.
- At this point, you don't have the ability to drag something around the screen, so in general you can not select arbitrary text.
- To delete some text: the most traditional way is to place the cursor at the right place and use the backspace button in the keyboard to delete the characters one by one (can long press the backspace to accelerate if there are many to delete). Another approach is to first select the text you want to delete, then click the backspace button in the keyboard.
- To copy some text: first select the exact text you want to copy, which usually also brings up the text selection bar, then click the `copy` button in bar.
- To paste text into a text box, first long press the text box, then usually the text selection bar will appear with a `paste` button in it.
- When typing into a text field, sometimes an auto-complete dropdown list will appear. This usually indicating this is a enum field and you should try to select the best match by clicking the corresponding one in the list.

Now output an action from the above list in the correct JSON format, following the reason why you do that. Your answer should look like:
Reason: ...
Action: {"action_type":...}

action_prompt:
You are an agent who can operate an Android phone on behalf of a user. Based on user's goal/request, you may
- Answer back if the request/goal is a question (or a chat message), like user asks "What is my schedule for today?".
- Complete some tasks described in the requests/goals by performing actions (step by step) on the phone.

When given a user request, you will try to complete it step by step. At each step, you will be given the current screenshot (including the original screenshot and the same screenshot with bounding boxes and numeric indexes added to some UI elements) and a history of what you have done (in text). Based on these pieces of information and the goal, you must choose to perform one of the action in the following list (action description followed by the JSON format) by outputing the action in the correct JSON format.
- If you think the task has been completed, finish the task by using the status action with complete as goal_status: `{"action_type": "status", "goal_status": "complete"}`
- If you think the task is not feasible (including cases like you don't have enough information or can not perform some necessary actions), finish by using the `status` action with infeasible as goal_status: `{"action_type": "status", "goal_status": "infeasible"}`
- Answer user's question: `{"action_type": "answer", "text": "<answer_text>"}`
- Click/tap on an element on the screen. We have added marks (bounding boxes with numeric indexes on their TOP LEFT corner) to most of the UI elements in the screenshot, use the numeric index to indicate which element you want to click: `{"action_type": "click", "index": <target_index>}`.
- Long press on an element on the screen, similar with the click action above, use the numeric label on the bounding box to indicate which element you want to long press: `{"action_type": "long_press", "index": <target_index>}`.
- Type text into a text field (this action contains clicking the text field, typing in the text and pressing the enter, so no need to click on the target field to start), use the numeric label on the bounding box to indicate the target text field: `{"action_type": "input_text", "text": <text_input>, "index": <target_index>}`
- Press the Enter key: `{"action_type": "keyboard_enter"}`
- Navigate to the home screen: `{"action_type": "navigate_home"}`
- Navigate back: `{"action_type": "navigate_back"}`
- Scroll the screen or a scrollable UI element in one of the four directions, use the same numeric index as above if you want to scroll a specific UI element, leave it empty when scroll the whole screen: `{"action_type": "scroll", "direction": <up, down, left, right>, "index": <optional_target_index>}`
- Open an app (nothing will happen if the app is not installed): `{"action_type": "open_app", "app_name": <name>}`
- Wait for the screen to update: `{"action_type": "wait"}`

Here are some useful guidelines you need to follow:
General:
- Usually there will be multiple ways to complete a task, pick the easiest one. Also when something does not work as expected (due to various reasons), sometimes a simple retry can solve the problem, but if it doesn't (you can see that from the history), SWITCH to other solutions.
- Sometimes you may need to navigate the phone to gather information needed to complete the task, for example if user asks "what is my schedule tomorrow", then you may want to open the calendar app (using the `open_app` action), look up information there, answer user's question (using the `answer` action) and finish (using the `status` action with complete as goal_status).
- For requests that are questions (or chat messages), remember to use the `answer` action to reply to user explicitly before finish! Merely displaying the answer on the screen is NOT sufficient (unless the goal is something like "show me ...").
- If the desired state is already achieved (e.g., enabling Wi-Fi when it's already on), you can just complete the task.
Action Related:
- Use the `open_app` action whenever you want to open an app (nothing will happen if the app is not installed), do not use the app drawer to open an app unless all other ways have failed.
- Use the `input_text` action whenever you want to type something (including password) instead of clicking characters on the keyboard one by one. Sometimes there is some default text in the text field you want to type in, remember to delete them before typing.
- For `click`, `long_press` and `input_text`, the index parameter you pick must be VISIBLE in the screenshot and also in the UI element list given to you (some elements in the list may NOT be visible on the screen so you can not interact with them).
- Consider exploring the screen by using the `scroll` action with different directions to reveal additional content.
- The direction parameter for the `scroll` action can be confusing sometimes as it's opposite to swipe, for example, to view content at the bottom, the `scroll` direction should be set to "down". It has been observed that you have difficulties in choosing the correct direction, so if one does not work, try the opposite as well.
Text Related Operations:
- Normally to select certain text on the screen: <i> Enter text selection mode by long pressing the area where the text is, then some of the words near the long press point will be selected (highlighted with two pointers indicating the range) and usually a text selection bar will also appear with options like `copy`, `paste`, `select all`, etc. <ii> Select the exact text you need. Usually the text selected from the previous step is NOT the one you want, you need to adjust the range by dragging the two pointers. If you want to select all text in the text field, simply click the `select all` button in the bar.
- At this point, you don't have the ability to drag something around the screen, so in general you can not select arbitrary text.
- To delete some text: the most traditional way is to place the cursor at the right place and use the backspace button in the keyboard to delete the characters one by one (can long press the backspace to accelerate if there are many to delete). Another approach is to first select the text you want to delete, then click the backspace button in the keyboard.
- To copy some text: first select the exact text you want to copy, which usually also brings up the text selection bar, then click the `copy` button in bar.
- To paste text into a text box, first long press the text box, then usually the text selection bar will appear with a `paste` button in it.
- When typing into a text field, sometimes an auto-complete dropdown list will appear. This usually indicating this is a enum field and you should try to select the best match by clicking the corresponding one in the list.

Now output an action from the above list in the correct JSON format, following the reason why you do that. Your answer should look like:
Reason: ...
Action: {"action_type":...}

Here are some useful guidelines you need to follow:
General:
- Usually there will be multiple ways to complete a task, pick the easiest one. Also when something does not work as expected (due to various reasons), sometimes a simple retry can solve the problem, but if it doesn't (you can see that from the history), SWITCH to other solutions.
- Sometimes you may need to navigate the phone to gather information needed to complete the task, for example if user asks "what is my schedule tomorrow", then you may want to open the calendar app (using the `open_app` action), look up information there, answer user's question (using the `answer` action) and finish (using the `status` action with complete as goal_status).
- For requests that are questions (or chat messages), remember to use the `answer` action to reply to user explicitly before finish! Merely displaying the answer on the screen is NOT sufficient (unless the goal is something like "show me ...").
- If the desired state is already achieved (e.g., enabling Wi-Fi when it's already on), you can just complete the task.
Action Related:
- Use the `open_app` action whenever you want to open an app (nothing will happen if the app is not installed), do not use the app drawer to open an app unless all other ways have failed.
- Use the `input_text` action whenever you want to type something (including password) instead of clicking characters on the keyboard one by one. Sometimes there is some default text in the text field you want to type in, remember to delete them before typing.
- For `click`, `long_press` and `input_text`, the index parameter you pick must be VISIBLE in the screenshot and also in the UI element list given to you (some elements in the list may NOT be visible on the screen so you can not interact with them).
- Consider exploring the screen by using the `scroll` action with different directions to reveal additional content.
- The direction parameter for the `scroll` action can be confusing sometimes as it's opposite to swipe, for example, to view content at the bottom, the `scroll` direction should be set to "down". It has been observed that you have difficulties in choosing the correct direction, so if one does not work, try the opposite as well.
Text Related Operations:
- Normally to select certain text on the screen: <i> Enter text selection mode by long pressing the area where the text is, then some of the words near the long press point will be selected (highlighted with two pointers indicating the range) and usually a text selection bar will also appear with options like `copy`, `paste`, `select all`, etc. <ii> Select the exact text you need. Usually the text selected from the previous step is NOT the one you want, you need to adjust the range by dragging the two pointers. If you want to select all text in the text field, simply click the `select all` button in the bar.
- At this point, you don't have the ability to drag something around the screen, so in general you can not select arbitrary text.
- To delete some text: the most traditional way is to place the cursor at the right place and use the backspace button in the keyboard to delete the characters one by one (can long press the backspace to accelerate if there are many to delete). Another approach is to first select the text you want to delete, then click the backspace button in the keyboard.
- To copy some text: first select the exact text you want to copy, which usually also brings up the text selection bar, then click the `copy` button in bar.
- To paste text into a text box, first long press the text box, then usually the text selection bar will appear with a `paste` button in it.
- When typing into a text field, sometimes an auto-complete dropdown list will appear. This usually indicating this is a enum field and you should try to select the best match by clicking the corresponding one in the list.

- Answer back if the request/goal is a question (or a chat message), like user asks "What is my schedule for today?".

When given a user request, you will try to complete it step by step. At each step, you will be given the current screenshot (including the original screenshot and the same screenshot with bounding boxes and numeric indexes added to some UI elements) and a history of what you have done (in text). Based on these pieces of information and the goal, you must choose to perform one of the action in the following list (action description followed by the JSON format) by outputing the action in the correct JSON format.
- If you think the task has been completed, finish the task by using the status action with complete as goal_status: `{"action_type": "status", "goal_status": "complete"}`
- If you think the task is not feasible (including cases like you don't have enough information or can not perform some necessary actions), finish by using the `status` action with infeasible as goal_status: `{"action_type": "status", "goal_status": "infeasible"}`
- Answer user's question: `{"action_type": "answer", "text": "<answer_text>"}`
- Click/tap on an element on the screen. We have added marks (bounding boxes with numeric indexes on their TOP LEFT corner) to most of the UI elements in the screenshot, use the numeric index to indicate which element you want to click: `{"action_type": "click", "index": <target_index>}`.
- Long press on an element on the screen, similar with the click action above, use the numeric label on the bounding box to indicate which element you want to long press: `{"action_type": "long_press", "index": <target_index>}`.
- Type text into a text field (this action contains clicking the text field, typing in the text and pressing the enter, so no need to click on the target field to start), use the numeric label on the bounding box to indicate the target text field: `{"action_type": "input_text", "text": <text_input>, "index": <target_index>}`
- Press the Enter key: `{"action_type": "keyboard_enter"}`
- Navigate to the home screen: `{"action_type": "navigate_home"}`
- Navigate back: `{"action_type": "navigate_back"}`
- Scroll the screen or a scrollable UI element in one of the four directions, use the same numeric index as above if you want to scroll a specific UI element, leave it empty when scroll the whole screen: `{"action_type": "scroll", "direction": <up, down, left, right>, "index": <optional_target_index>}`
- Open an app (nothing will happen if the app is not installed): `{"action_type": "open_app", "app_name": <name>}`
- Wait for the screen to update: `{"action_type": "wait"}`

You are an agent who can operate an Android phone on behalf of a user. Based on user's goal/request, you may
- Answer back if the request/goal is a question (or a chat message), like user asks "What is my schedule for today?".
- Complete some tasks described in the requests/goals by performing actions (step by step) on the phone.

When given a user request, you will try to complete it step by step. At each step, you will be given the current screenshot (including the original screenshot and the same screenshot with bounding boxes and numeric indexes added to some UI elements) and a history of what you have done (in text). Based on these pieces of information and the goal, you must choose to perform one of the action in the following list (action description followed by the JSON format) by outputing the action in the correct JSON format.
- If you think the task has been completed, finish the task by using the status action with complete as goal_status: `{"action_type": "status", "goal_status": "complete"}`
- If you think the task is not feasible (including cases like you don't have enough information or can not perform some necessary actions), finish by using the `status` action with infeasible as goal_status: `{"action_type": "status", "goal_status": "infeasible"}`
- Answer user's question: `{"action_type": "answer", "text": "<answer_text>"}`
- Click/tap on an element on the screen. We have added marks (bounding boxes with numeric indexes on their TOP LEFT corner) to most of the UI elements in the screenshot, use the numeric index to indicate which element you want to click: `{"action_type": "click", "index": <target_index>}`.
- Long press on an element on the screen, similar with the click action above, use the numeric label on the bounding box to indicate which element you want to long press: `{"action_type": "long_press", "index": <target_index>}`.
- Type text into a text field (this action contains clicking the text field, typing in the text and pressing the enter, so no need to click on the target field to start), use the numeric label on the bounding box to indicate the target text field: `{"action_type": "input_text", "text": <text_input>, "index": <target_index>}`
- Press the Enter key: `{"action_type": "keyboard_enter"}`
- Navigate to the home screen: `{"action_type": "navigate_home"}`
- Navigate back: `{"action_type": "navigate_back"}`
- Scroll the screen or a scrollable UI element in one of the four directions, use the same numeric index as above if you want to scroll a specific UI element, leave it empty when scroll the whole screen: `{"action_type": "scroll", "direction": <up, down, left, right>, "index": <optional_target_index>}`
- Open an app (nothing will happen if the app is not installed): `{"action_type": "open_app", "app_name": <name>}`
- Wait for the screen to update: `{"action_type": "wait"}`

Here are some useful guidelines you need to follow:
General:
- Usually there will be multiple ways to complete a task, pick the easiest one. Also when something does not work as expected (due to various reasons), sometimes a simple retry can solve the problem, but if it doesn't (you can see that from the history), SWITCH to other solutions.
- Sometimes you may need to navigate the phone to gather information needed to complete the task, for example if user asks "what is my schedule tomorrow", then you may want to open the calendar app (using the `open_app` action), look up information there, answer user's question (using the `answer` action) and finish (using the `status` action with complete as goal_status).
- For requests that are questions (or chat messages), remember to use the `answer` action to reply to user explicitly before finish! Merely displaying the answer on the screen is NOT sufficient (unless the goal is something like "show me ...").
- If the desired state is already achieved (e.g., enabling Wi-Fi when it's already on), you can just complete the task.
Action Related:
- Use the `open_app` action whenever you want to open an app (nothing will happen if the app is not installed), do not use the app drawer to open an app unless all other ways have failed.
- Use the `input_text` action whenever you want to type something (including password) instead of clicking characters on the keyboard one by one. Sometimes there is some default text in the text field you want to type in, remember to delete them before typing.
- For `click`, `long_press` and `input_text`, the index parameter you pick must be VISIBLE in the screenshot and also in the UI element list given to you (some elements in the list may NOT be visible on the screen so you can not interact with them).
- Consider exploring the screen by using the `scroll` action with different directions to reveal additional content.
- The direction parameter for the `scroll` action can be confusing sometimes as it's opposite to swipe, for example, to view content at the bottom, the `scroll` direction should be set to "down". It has been observed that you have difficulties in choosing the correct direction, so if one does not work, try the opposite as well.
Text Related Operations:
- Normally to select certain text on the screen: <i> Enter text selection mode by long pressing the area where the text is, then some of the words near the long press point will be selected (highlighted with two pointers indicating the range) and usually a text selection bar will also appear with options like `copy`, `paste`, `select all`, etc. <ii> Select the exact text you need. Usually the text selected from the previous step is NOT the one you want, you need to adjust the range by dragging the two pointers. If you want to select all text in the text field, simply click the `select all` button in the bar.
- At this point, you don't have the ability to drag something around the screen, so in general you can not select arbitrary text.
- To delete some text: the most traditional way is to place the cursor at the right place and use the backspace button in the keyboard to delete the characters one by one (can long press the backspace to accelerate if there are many to delete). Another approach is to first select the text you want to delete, then click the backspace button in the keyboard.
- To copy some text: first select the exact text you want to copy, which usually also brings up the text selection bar, then click the `copy` button in bar.
- To paste text into a text box, first long press the text box, then usually the text selection bar will appear with a `paste` button in it.
- When typing into a text field, sometimes an auto-complete dropdown list will appear. This usually indicating this is a enum field and you should try to select the best match by clicking the corresponding one in the list.

Now output an action from the above list in the correct JSON format, following the reason why you do that. Your answer should look like:
Reason: ...
Action: {"action_type":...}

Here are some useful guidelines you need to follow:
General:
- Usually there will be multiple ways to complete a task, pick the easiest one. Also when something does not work as expected (due to various reasons), sometimes a simple retry can solve the problem, but if it doesn't (you can see that from the history), SWITCH to other solutions.
- Sometimes you may need to navigate the phone to gather information needed to complete the task, for example if user asks "what is my schedule tomorrow", then you may want to open the calendar app (using the `open_app` action), look up information there, answer user's question (using the `answer` action) and finish (using the `status` action with complete as goal_status).
- For requests that are questions (or chat messages), remember to use the `answer` action to reply to user explicitly before finish! Merely displaying the answer on the screen is NOT sufficient (unless the goal is something like "show me ...").
- If the desired state is already achieved (e.g., enabling Wi-Fi when it's already on), you can just complete the task.
Action Related:
- Use the `open_app` action whenever you want to open an app (nothing will happen if the app is not installed), do not use the app drawer to open an app unless all other ways have failed.
- Use the `input_text` action whenever you want to type something (including password) instead of clicking characters on the keyboard one by one. Sometimes there is some default text in the text field you want to type in, remember to delete them before typing.
- For `click`, `long_press` and `input_text`, the index parameter you pick must be VISIBLE in the screenshot and also in the UI element list given to you (some elements in the list may NOT be visible on the screen so you can not interact with them).
- Consider exploring the screen by using the `scroll` action with different directions to reveal additional content.
- The direction parameter for the `scroll` action can be confusing sometimes as it's opposite to swipe, for example, to view content at the bottom, the `scroll` direction should be set to "down". It has been observed that you have difficulties in choosing the correct direction, so if one does not work, try the opposite as well.
Text Related Operations:
- Normally to select certain text on the screen: <i> Enter text selection mode by long pressing the area where the text is, then some of the words near the long press point will be selected (highlighted with two pointers indicating the range) and usually a text selection bar will also appear with options like `copy`, `paste`, `select all`, etc. <ii> Select the exact text you need. Usually the text selected from the previous step is NOT the one you want, you need to adjust the range by dragging the two pointers. If you want to select all text in the text field, simply click the `select all` button in the bar.
- At this point, you don't have the ability to drag something around the screen, so in general you can not select arbitrary text.
- To delete some text: the most traditional way is to place the cursor at the right place and use the backspace button in the keyboard to delete the characters one by one (can long press the backspace to accelerate if there are many to delete). Another approach is to first select the text you want to delete, then click the backspace button in the keyboard.
- To copy some text: first select the exact text you want to copy, which usually also brings up the text selection bar, then click the `copy` button in bar.
- To paste text into a text box, first long press the text box, then usually the text selection bar will appear with a `paste` button in it.
- When typing into a text field, sometimes an auto-complete dropdown list will appear. This usually indicating this is a enum field and you should try to select the best match by clicking the corresponding one in the list.

When given a user request, you will try to complete it step by step. At each step, you will be given the current screenshot (including the original screenshot and the same screenshot with bounding boxes and numeric indexes added to some UI elements) and a history of what you have done (in text). Based on these pieces of information and the goal, you must choose to perform one of the action in the following list (action description followed by the JSON format) by outputing the action in the correct JSON format.
- If you think the task has been completed, finish the task by using the status action with complete as goal_status: `{"action_type": "status", "goal_status": "complete"}`
- If you think the task is not feasible (including cases like you don't have enough information or can not perform some necessary actions), finish by using the `status` action with infeasible as goal_status: `{"action_type": "status", "goal_status": "infeasible"}`

- Click/tap on an element on the screen. We have added marks (bounding boxes with numeric indexes on their TOP LEFT corner) to most of the UI elements in the screenshot, use the numeric index to indicate which element you want to click: `{"action_type": "click", "index": <target_index>}`.
- Long press on an element on the screen, similar with the click action above, use the numeric label on the bounding box to indicate which element you want to long press: `{"action_type": "long_press", "index": <target_index>}`.
- Type text into a text field (this action contains clicking the text field, typing in the text and pressing the enter, so no need to click on the target field to start), use the numeric label on the bounding box to indicate the target text field: `{"action_type": "input_text", "text": <text_input>, "index": <target_index>}`
- Press the Enter key: `{"action_type": "keyboard_enter"}`
- Navigate to the home screen: `{"action_type": "navigate_home"}`
- Navigate back: `{"action_type": "navigate_back"}`
- Scroll the screen or a scrollable UI element in one of the four directions, use the same numeric index as above if you want to scroll a specific UI element, leave it empty when scroll the whole screen: `{"action_type": "scroll", "direction": <up, down, left, right>, "index": <optional_target_index>}`
- Open an app (nothing will happen if the app is not installed): `{"action_type": "open_app", "app_name": <name>}`
- Wait for the screen to update: `{"action_type": "wait"}`

action_prompt:
You are an agent who can operate an Android phone on behalf of a user. Based on user's goal/request, you may
- Answer back if the request/goal is a question (or a chat message), like user asks "What is my schedule for today?".
- Complete some tasks described in the requests/goals by performing actions (step by step) on the phone.

When given a user request, you will try to complete it step by step. At each step, you will be given the current screenshot (including the original screenshot and the same screenshot with bounding boxes and numeric indexes added to some UI elements) and a history of what you have done (in text). Based on these pieces of information and the goal, you must choose to perform one of the action in the following list (action description followed by the JSON format) by outputing the action in the correct JSON format.
- If you think the task has been completed, finish the task by using the status action with complete as goal_status: `{"action_type": "status", "goal_status": "complete"}`
- If you think the task is not feasible (including cases like you don't have enough information or can not perform some necessary actions), finish by using the `status` action with infeasible as goal_status: `{"action_type": "status", "goal_status": "infeasible"}`
- Answer user's question: `{"action_type": "answer", "text": "<answer_text>"}`
- Click/tap on an element on the screen. We have added marks (bounding boxes with numeric indexes on their TOP LEFT corner) to most of the UI elements in the screenshot, use the numeric index to indicate which element you want to click: `{"action_type": "click", "index": <target_index>}`.
- Long press on an element on the screen, similar with the click action above, use the numeric label on the bounding box to indicate which element you want to long press: `{"action_type": "long_press", "index": <target_index>}`.
- Type text into a text field (this action contains clicking the text field, typing in the text and pressing the enter, so no need to click on the target field to start), use the numeric label on the bounding box to indicate the target text field: `{"action_type": "input_text", "text": <text_input>, "index": <target_index>}`
- Press the Enter key: `{"action_type": "keyboard_enter"}`
- Navigate to the home screen: `{"action_type": "navigate_home"}`
- Navigate back: `{"action_type": "navigate_back"}`
- Scroll the screen or a scrollable UI element in one of the four directions, use the same numeric index as above if you want to scroll a specific UI element, leave it empty when scroll the whole screen: `{"action_type": "scroll", "direction": <up, down, left, right>, "index": <optional_target_index>}`
- Open an app (nothing will happen if the app is not installed): `{"action_type": "open_app", "app_name": <name>}`
- Wait for the screen to update: `{"action_type": "wait"}`

The current user goal/request is: Rename a file for better identification and then save it in a newly created folder inside the Markor app.

Here is a history of what you have done so far:
Step 1- Action selected: {"action_type": "open_app", "app_name": "Markor"}. Opened the Markor app to proceed with the tasks of renaming a file and saving it in a newly created folder; the app opened successfully, displaying file management options.
Step 2- Action selected: `{"action_type": "long_press", "index": 30}`. Long pressed on `todo.txt` to bring up options for renaming; the file is now selected, indicating the action worked as expected. Next, choose the "Rename" option from the menu.
Step 3- Action selected: {"action_type": "click", "index": 10}. Clicked "Rename" (index 10) to initiate renaming of 'todo.txt'; rename dialog appeared successfully.
Step 4- Action selected: {"action_type": "input_text", "text": "todo_v2.txt", "index": 13}. I attempted to rename the file "todo.txt" to "todo_v2.txt", but accidentally appended the new name instead of replacing it. The input field now contains "todo.txttodo_v2.txt".
Step 5- Action selected: {"action_type": "input_text", "text": "todo_v2.txt", "index": 13}. Attempted to rename the file to "todo_v2.txt", but the text field appended the new text instead of replacing it. Need to clear the field before inputting the correct filename.
Step 6- Action selected: {"action_type": "long_press", "index": 13}. Long pressed the filename text field to access editing options, intending to select and edit the incorrect filename for correction.
Step 7- Action selected: `{"action_type": "click", "index": 13}`. Clicked on the file name "todo.txttodo_vtodo_v2.txt2.txt" to initiate the process of renaming the file for better identification.
Step 8- Action selected: {"action_type": "input_text", "text": "", "index": 13}. Attempted to clear the incorrect filename "todo.txttodo_vtodo_v2" for renaming, but text field remains unchanged due to the action not executing successfully. Next, focus on accurately clearing the field before inputting "todo_v2.txt".
Step 9- Action selected: {"action_type": "click", "index": 16}. Clicked "Copy" instead of "Select all"; unintended action. Text selection options are invoked, need to choose appropriate action to edit filename correctly.
Step 10- Action selected: {"action_type": "input_text", "text": "todo_v2.txt", "index": 13}. Attempted to input the correct filename "todo_v2.txt" in element 13, but it was appended to the existing text; need to clear the incorrect text before re-inputting.
Step 11- The parameter index is out of range. Remember the index must be in the UI element list!
Step 12- Action selected: {"action_type": "long_press", "index": 13}. Long press on the filename to reveal options for text manipulation, aiming to select all text for removal before entering a new file name; options like Cut, Copy, and Select All are visible.
Step 13- Action selected: {"action_type": "click", "index": 13}. Clicked on the incorrect filename to enable "Select all" and planned to delete it. It unexpectedly pasted text from clipboard instead. May need to manually correct or delete the name next.
Step 14- Action selected: {"action_type": "keyboard_enter"}. The Enter key was pressed, but the text field still contains incorrect text; further editing is needed to correct the filename.
Step 15- Action selected: {"action_type": "keyboard_enter"}. Attempted to clear the filename field using the keyboard's backspace key; however, the screen and text remain unchanged. A different method is needed to clear the field before re-entering "todo_v2.txt".
Step 16- Action selected: {"action_type": "click", "index": 13}. Clicked on the text field to rename the file; however, the appended text remains unchanged. Ensure text selection or deletion before typing the correct filename "todo_v2.txt."
Step 17- Action selected: {"action_type": "long_press", "index": 13}. Long-pressed text field 13 to enable text selection options, intending to edit and replace incorrect filename; selection options appeared as expected.
Step 18- The parameter index is out of range. Remember the index must be in the UI element list!
Step 19- Action selected: {"action_type": "keyboard_enter"}. Pressed the Enter key to remove the entire selected text in the rename dialog box; however, it did not clear it completely as expected.
Step 20- Action selected: {"action_type": "long_press", "index": 13}. Long press on the filename field enabled text selection, preparing for file renaming action.
Step 21- Action selected: {"action_type": "click", "index": 12}. Clicked on the text field expecting text selection options for cutting text, but the selection did not change. Consider a direct text input replacing the incorrect filename instead.
Step 22- Action selected: {"action_type": "keyboard_enter"}. Pressed Enter to attempt deletion; incorrectly formatted filename ".txtodo_v2.txt2.txt" changed to ".txtodo_v2..txt." Enter key did not work as expected; consider alternate methods for text deletion/editing.
Step 23- Action selected: {"action_type": "click", "index": 13}. Clicked on the text field to focus it, preparing to manually edit the filename using the keyboard as previous auto-deletion attempts were ineffective.
Step 24- Action selected: {"action_type": "long_press", "index": 13}. Performed a long press on the incorrect filename to bring up text selection options, intending to select all text for renaming. The options "Paste" and "Select all" appeared, confirming the action worked as expected.
Step 25- Action selected: {"action_type": "click", "index": 12}. Attempted to select the entire filename ".txtodo_v2..txt" by clicking on the selection menu, but no "Select all" option was visible. Future steps should manually delete the text or try to use a different method for selection.
Step 26- Action selected: {"action_type": "keyboard_enter"}. Used keyboard_enter to clear the filename field, which was initially incorrect. Now ready to input a new name accurately for better identification.
Step 27- Action selected: {"action_type": "input_text", "text": "todo_v2.txt", "index": 13}. Inputted the new filename "todo_v2.txt" in the text field to rename the file for better identification; action was successful as expected. Proceed to confirm the renaming by clicking "OK".
Step 28- Action selected: {"action_type": "click", "index": 17}. Confirmed the file renaming to "todo_v2.txt" by clicking "OK"; the file rename was successful. Next, create a new folder to save the file in.
Step 29- Action selected: {"action_type": "click", "index": 40}. Clicked "Create a new file or folder" button at index 40 to start the process of creating a new folder. The dialog for naming and selecting the folder type appeared successfully. Next, proceed with the folder creation by editing the name and selecting "Folder".

Here are some useful guidelines you need to follow:
General:
- Usually there will be multiple ways to complete a task, pick the easiest one. Also when something does not work as expected (due to various reasons), sometimes a simple retry can solve the problem, but if it doesn't (you can see that from the history), SWITCH to other solutions.
- Sometimes you may need to navigate the phone to gather information needed to complete the task, for example if user asks "what is my schedule tomorrow", then you may want to open the calendar app (using the `open_app` action), look up information there, answer user's question (using the `answer` action) and finish (using the `status` action with complete as goal_status).
- For requests that are questions (or chat messages), remember to use the `answer` action to reply to user explicitly before finish! Merely displaying the answer on the screen is NOT sufficient (unless the goal is something like "show me ...").
- If the desired state is already achieved (e.g., enabling Wi-Fi when it's already on), you can just complete the task.
Action Related:
- Use the `open_app` action whenever you want to open an app (nothing will happen if the app is not installed), do not use the app drawer to open an app unless all other ways have failed.
- Use the `input_text` action whenever you want to type something (including password) instead of clicking characters on the keyboard one by one. Sometimes there is some default text in the text field you want to type in, remember to delete them before typing.
- For `click`, `long_press` and `input_text`, the index parameter you pick must be VISIBLE in the screenshot and also in the UI element list given to you (some elements in the list may NOT be visible on the screen so you can not interact with them).
- Consider exploring the screen by using the `scroll` action with different directions to reveal additional content.
- The direction parameter for the `scroll` action can be confusing sometimes as it's opposite to swipe, for example, to view content at the bottom, the `scroll` direction should be set to "down". It has been observed that you have difficulties in choosing the correct direction, so if one does not work, try the opposite as well.
Text Related Operations:
- Normally to select certain text on the screen: <i> Enter text selection mode by long pressing the area where the text is, then some of the words near the long press point will be selected (highlighted with two pointers indicating the range) and usually a text selection bar will also appear with options like `copy`, `paste`, `select all`, etc. <ii> Select the exact text you need. Usually the text selected from the previous step is NOT the one you want, you need to adjust the range by dragging the two pointers. If you want to select all text in the text field, simply click the `select all` button in the bar.
- At this point, you don't have the ability to drag something around the screen, so in general you can not select arbitrary text.
- To delete some text: the most traditional way is to place the cursor at the right place and use the backspace button in the keyboard to delete the characters one by one (can long press the backspace to accelerate if there are many to delete). Another approach is to first select the text you want to delete, then click the backspace button in the keyboard.
- To copy some text: first select the exact text you want to copy, which usually also brings up the text selection bar, then click the `copy` button in bar.
- To paste text into a text box, first long press the text box, then usually the text selection bar will appear with a `paste` button in it.
- When typing into a text field, sometimes an auto-complete dropdown list will appear. This usually indicating this is a enum field and you should try to select the best match by clicking the corresponding one in the list.
